item.title: Resources for Hugo (obviously this page is still in development)
Limitations of Wearable Devices in Detecting Heart Arrythmia
item.description: WEBSITE IN DEVELOPMENT, ignore the following, it’s a test. Heart rate metrics in wearable devices is nothing new. Fitbit has been doing it for decades, and Apple has recently been dominating the market with Apple Watches. A group at UT Austin has compared the performance of wearables over activity levels. You can see it here. When it comes to cardiac arrythmia, atrial fibrillation (AFIB) seems to be relatively easy for wearable devices to detect.
